title: SEC Wonâ€™t Approve Leveraged Bitcoin Fund
sub_head: Regulator has signaled it will allow only unleveraged funds tied to the cryptocurrency, at least for now
body:
The Securities and Exchange Commission asked at least one asset manager not to proceed with plans for a leveraged bitcoin exchange-traded fund, according to a person familiar with the matter.
The SEC indicated it wants to limit new bitcoin-related products to those that provide unleveraged exposure to bitcoin futures contracts, such as the exchange-traded fund, which was launched last week, the person said.
